Description: Undyed sprang linen hair-net; tapers towards the bottom by means of increasingly large groups of warp thread; geometric design is produced by denser and less dense areas; originally with red stripes parallel to the side seams; hanging from the bottom of the bag, from the centre line of the web, is a tassel of looped threads tied together at the bottom, originally consisted of cords of linen and red wool (now missing) plied together; side seam (now missing) and a brow band were probably also originally sewn in red wool; edge of the opening was threaded with a double cord which also originally contained a second strand of red wool; warp-linen (S spun Z ply); four original edges, consisting of simple selvedges, now separated, one end has a draw string and other end is still partly threaded with a red woollen cord; some darning in linen thread (S spun Z ply)
Exhibition history: Exhibited: 1997 22 Oct-1998 30 Apr, Italy, Rome, Fondaione Memmo, Ancient Faces 2000 Feb-May, Metropolitan Museum of Art, Ancient Faces
Acquisition name: Purchased through: Sir Ernest A T Wallis Budge
